An ORCID iD is a unique researcher identifier, used worldwide, that you can keep throughout your life and retain even if you move institutions. Short for Open Researcher and Contributor Identifier, it distinguishes you from other researchers, even if they have the same name, and enables authoritative links to be created between you and your research activities.

Manage Your ORCID

UVA Library has built the UVA-ORCID Connector service, which allows you to verify your UVA affiliation. When you connect your ORCID to UVA, you authorize display and use of your ORCID iD in the University of Virginia’s systems. 

Visit the UVA-ORCID Connector to create or connect an iD and to authorize the display and use of your ORCID iD in the University of Virginia’s systems.

Note that:

  • Your iD can be connected to an institution only with your direct permission.
  • You may remove the institution connection to your iD at any time.
  • You may change visibility, share, or remove information, such as scholarship works in your ORCID record at any time.
  • You can add more identifying information to your ORCID record at any time.

Share Your ORCID

  • Once you connect your ORCID iD to UVA, the Library’s Libra scholarly repository shows your ORCID iD on each LibraETD or LibraOpen work for which you are an author or co-author, and adds citations of the work to your ORCID profile.
  • Look for more ways to share your ORCID iD in other UVA services soon.
